title: Malaysian Soldier Grabs Hold Of Deadly King Cobra With Bare Hands Without A Care In The World
text:
Malaysian Soldier Grabs Hold Of Deadly King Cobra With Bare Hands Without A Care In The World

Malaysian Soldier Grabs Hold Of Deadly King Cobra With Bare Hands Without A Care In The World

No one can mess with a King Cobra apart from trained professionals, of course. But this Malaysian soldier has taken the Internet by storm after he fearlessly confronted the deadly reptile.

The footage was captured by an onlooker and it shows the Malaysian soldier, from the Tentera Darat Army, walk down a dirt road surrounded by foliage, and move towards the snake.

YouTube

The video then goes on to show the soldier getting close to the snake and grabbing the serpent’s head with his bare hands. The snake begins to coil and wriggle but the soldier keeps his firm grip with no sign of fear.

The soldier reportedly noticed the 1.8-metre (6-feet) snake when he was walking down a dirt road and decided to tackle it.

The venomous snake has been listed as “vulnerable” on the Red List of International Union for Conservation of Nature because of its habitat loss.

They say the King Cobra has enough venom to kill an elephant or at least 15-20 human beings and its bite contains five times more poison than a black mamba’s.
description: A Malaysian soldier from the Tentera Darat Army has been captured on video while cleverly taming a king cobra, which is considered to be the largest venomous snake on the planet. The soldier reportedly noticed the 1.8-metre (6-feet) snake when he was descending a dirt road surrounded by palm trees.
